lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 8 — Underscoring the skyrocketing value of commodities amid increasingly tight supplies, Rio Tinto, the London- and Melbourne-based mining company, rejected a $140 billion bid Thursday from its rival, BHP Billiton — calling it too low. The move squelched, at least for now, what would have been one of the largest acquisitions in corporate history.

headline.main: Mine Giant Rejects Bid From Rival
headline.print_headline: Mine Giant Rejects Bid From Rival

byline.original: By Julia Werdigier and Wayne Arnold

abstract: Rio Tinto‘s rejection of a $140 billion all-share offer from BHP Billiton is likely to trigger rival bids from resource companies awash with cash from record commodity and stock prices, analysts said.
